page.title: 11Leisure in Glenisla.
page.content: The Women's Rural Institute is held in Glenisla Hall once a month and is well attended, with guest speakers talking about a wide variety of subjects. An outdoor recreational centre provides the opportunity to participate in pony trekking, sailing, grass-skiing,archery,abseiling with cross-country and downhill skiing in winter. One of the two local hotels also runs a pony trekking centre. Discos are held in the Glen for the entertainment of the younger generation. Both hotels provide the locals with a meeting place in which to socialise and meet visitors to the Glen. Clay-pigeon shoots are regularly enjoyed and arranged by the Glenisla Gun Club.
